title: Citi Uruguay Launches Green Campaign "Less Paper - More Notebooks"
summary: Montevideo, Uruguay – Citi Uruguay announced the launching of their new Citi Green campaign during a paper-recycling workshop for employee's children.
tag-1: Citi Uruguay Launches Green Campaign "Less Paper - More Notebooks"
tag-3: Montevideo, Uruguay – Citi Uruguay announced the launching of their new Citi Green campaign during a paper-recycling workshop for employee's children.
tag-4: The Citi Green campaign aims to encourage customers to receive their bank account and credit-card statements via email instead of through printed statements.
tag-5: The objective is to promote the responsible use of paper among customers, while generating a social benefit that encourages them to receive statements by email. By migrating to electronic statements, the customers will benefit with a more efficient and faster service in addition to the benefits to society because of the reduction in paper consumption.
tag-6: "We are very pleased with the campaign," said Paul Oehler, Consumer Bank head for Citi Uruguay. "Our goal is to migrate the largest number of customers to the electronic format, and we believe the environmental and social benefits will be undoubtedly well-received and will generate a greater impact. Citi is committed to responsible business practices, especially with the promotion of environmental sustainability."
tag-7: For each customer that uses e-statements, Citi will donate US$2 to Repapel NGO, which will produce recycled-paper notebooks for children in two public schools. The notebooks will feature green tips and advice on how to develop good consumption and disposal habits.
tag-8: In turn, after a certain number of customers have migrated, a workshop on sustainable consumption and planting of fruit trees will be held in participating public schools. The selected schools were chosen from important areas in the country and are among the schools that already work with Repapel.
tag-9: Through the workshops, Citi seeks to encourage a thoughtful and responsible environmental approach on personal decisions in different environments, such as home, work and studying, while aiming to raise awareness and encourage the commitment to protecting the environment by taking action in things like, paper reduction, reutilization and recycling.
tag-10: "The launch was a success, and the kids shared a very enriching educational experience, with lessons they can take to their homes and schools," said Leticia Moreira, Public Affairs head.
tag-11: Citi Citi, the leading global financial services company, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-13: Repapel Repapel is a non-profit organization devoted to sustainable development education. Its programs aim, through awareness and education, to foster critical changes in relation to consumption and disposal patterns, while generating social and environmental impact (www.repapel.org).
